intro: Celmisia haastii var. tomentosa, commonly known as the silky celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its woolly, silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
